Ad Text:
Software Engineer (AI Systems)

LabNext70

2 x Fixed term positions, full-time up to 12 months

Armidale based role. Flexible or hybrid work arrangements available

Current UNE Staff: In taking up this appointment, please be aware your current fixed term or permanent role will cease the day prior to you taking this position

$ 110,591 to $ 128,345 per annum HEO8

Plus 17% employer superannuation

Salary packaging options are available

20 days family and domestic violence leave available per annum

10 days Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultural and ceremonial leave per annum

5 weeks annual leave plus Christmas week shutdown, per annum

Applicants must have appropriate Australian work rights for the duration of this position (UNE will not provide sponsorship for this position)

Acknowledgement of Country

The University of New England (UNE) is a regionally based, globally networked university renowned for the quality of its student experience and the excellence of its research specialisations. In addition, UNE pioneered teaching to external students making it the most experienced provider of distance and innovative online education. UNE emphasises its people, staff and students' growth and development. We aspire to be a leader in innovation and change and a centre for the Armidale and the North-West communities. Equity, diversity and inclusion are central to the core values of UNE and we are committed to engaging, supporting and growing a richly diverse workforce. From the Oorala Aboriginal Centre at the heart of our campus, to the inclusive organisations such as the UNE Ally Network, the UNE Women’s Society, and the many international cultural groups - all will feel valued and respected at UNE. You will embody the UNE values and strive to be Open, Enquiring, Exceptional and Making a Difference. Additionally, you will be committed to achieving the goals embedded in the Future Fit Strategic Plan 2021-2030.

About the role

The Software Engineer (AI Systems) is responsible for designing, building, and implementing complex software systems that support LabNext70's and the University's operational and strategic objectives. You will design and build software applications using AI/ML frameworks, cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), and containerisation technologies (Docker, Kubernetes). Leading technical architecture and design, you'll develop specifications for major projects and create enterprise-level APIs, microservices, and distributed system components. Your work will include implementing CI/CD pipelines, automated testing frameworks, and infrastructure as code. You'll solve complex technical problems, build proof-of-concepts to validate approaches, and research emerging technologies. Providing technical support to project teams and creating documentation will be key aspects of the role.

About you

To be successful in this role, you will have:

Expert-level programming and development skills across multiple languages (such as Python, Java, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, Go) with extensive experience building production-grade applications

Strong cloud and infrastructure expertise including cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP), containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes), infrastructure as code, and CI/CD pipeline implementation

Proven system architecture capabilities to design and build complex, scalable systems including microservices, distributed architectures, APIs, and database solutions

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with ability to tackle complex technical challenges, research emerging technologies, and develop innovative solutions

Strong communication and collaboration abilities to work effectively with stakeholders, translate business requirements into technical solutions, and deliver quality outcomes independently

About the Faculty/Group

LabNext70 is UNE's hub for AI innovation, where cutting-edge technology meets education. We're focused on transforming teaching and learning, improving operational efficiency, and exploring bold new ideas for the future of education. Working with partners across industry, government, and the community, we're pioneering AI-driven solutions that make a real difference. LabNext70 currently has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Software Engineer (AI Systems) to join our innovative team. This role offers the chance to work at the forefront of AI technology in higher education, designing and building complex software systems that drive innovation across the University. You'll work with cutting-edge technologies including AI/ML frameworks, cloud platforms, and modern development practices to create scalable solutions that enhance educational experiences and operational effectiveness. This is an opportunity to make a tangible impact while working in a collaborative, forward-thinking environment that values technical excellence and innovation.

About Armidale

Armidale is an attractive and vibrant city that combines all the features of a bustling regional town centre with the tranquillity of rural living. It boasts gourmet restaurants and cafes, boutique shopping, quality schools and sporting facilities. Surrounded by mountain gorges, waterfalls and national parks, Armidale’s natural beauty and distinct seasons make it an ideal place to live and thrive. To find out more, visit https://www.visitarmidale.com.au/experience

Enquiries and additional information

To discuss this role please contact Connor Ventura, AI Engineering Manager – LabNext70, phone: 02 6773 5109 email: cventur2@une.edu.au. 

Closing Date: Midnight, 23 November 2025

Reference No:   225166

Please visit www.une.edu.au/jobs-at-une for further information about this position and other career opportunities at UNE.

To Apply

Submit your application through www.une.edu.au/jobs-at-une and refer to vacancy ref 225166

Your application should be comprised of:

Covering letter addressing applicant’s suitability for the position based on key functions of the role detailed in the Position Description.

Current CV.

Commitment to Inclusion and Diversity

UNE is committed to building a diverse workforce and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Australians, people with disability, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds, mature age workers and LGBTQIA+ people. 

About Our Process

At UNE, we are committed to employing individuals who meet the requirements of this role and align with our values. All applicants will be contacted and advised of an outcome. The successful candidate will be required to undertake pre-employment checks prior to commencing in this role as indicated in the position statement. Please visit our Privacy Statement to understand how your information is collected, stored, accessed and used.

National Police Check

If you are the successful candidate for this role you will be required to provide UNE with a National Police Check prior to your commencement. Please note that people with criminal records are NOT automatically barred from applying for this position (unless there is a particular requirement under law).

Senior Solution Engineer – Applied AI Systems
Salary: $180,000 to $275,000 + share options

About the Role
This senior position suits an accomplished engineer who can lead the end-to-end delivery of AI solutions. You will design system architecture, guide technical direction and mentor others while staying hands-on across build and integration work.
The team develops advanced systems such as intelligent automation, agent frameworks and enterprise knowledge solutions using the latest model APIs and orchestration platforms.

Key Responsibilities
Lead architecture, design and delivery of scalable AI systems
Set technical standards and ensure reliability, security and quality
Oversee engineering decisions and code review across multiple projects
Work directly with senior stakeholders to translate requirements into solutions
Support and coach engineers to raise capability and delivery pace
Contribute to R&D and reusable components that accelerate future builds
You Will Bring
Strong background in software or data engineering with hands-on delivery experience
Deep knowledge of LLMs, vector databases, embeddings and model orchestration tools
Expertise in microservice design, API integration and data pipelines
Proven record leading teams building production-grade applications
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills
Proactive mindset, self-sufficiency and attention to technical quality
Why This Opportunity
Lead high-value projects using cutting-edge model technology
Join an elite engineering team working with world-class partners
Competitive salary, share options and full benefits package
Hybrid working model with flexibility for key client delivery
